Hey Rakel. This isnâ€™t a `sneaky hidden feature` of HubSpot, despite seeming like it. It is rather just a slightly obscure oddity of how theme templates kind of work.

The gist is that when you make a template file say `homePage.html` if it references `{% extends "./path/to/base.html" %}` it is technically, at the end of the day, nestled inside of the `base.html` file. And the oddity that I mentioned above is that you can create a variable inside of `homePage.html` called `{% set template_css = "path/to/template/file.css" %}` and it will be picked up and added to the base file.

You could, alternatively, just call `{{ require_css(get_asset_url("path/to/css_file.css")) }}` directly in `homePage.html` but doing so you have less control over where that css file is injected. This might result in cascading style clashes. But is 100% a valid technique :slightly_smiling_face:

Does that make sense?
Got it! That makes sense. Thank you. I'm going to give it a try!
